results.title: MIMA Yearbook. Vol. 2
results.brief_description: Volume two of a three volume set, this video compilation of excerpts of Australian film and video art covers the period from 1980-1983, and is a unique and tantalising entry into non-mainstream history of Australian film and video.

results.title: The Brotherhood of St Laurence
results.creator_credit: Brotherhood of St Lawrence Production Co
results.brief_description: The Brotherhood, which is based in Melbourne, works for a better deal for disadvantaged people. This documentary describes the Brotherhood’s beginnings; its current welfare services, including accommodation for older people, a material aid service, and a sheltered workshop; its support for other independent groups; and its involvement in social issues.

results.title: Image makers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ursula Kolbe and Institute of Early Childhood Studies (Waverley, N.S.W.)
results.brief_description:
Looks at the way children make images and how this helps them explore and cope with the world at large, giving it order and meaning.

Includes footage from the Murawina Aboriginal Education Centre in Redfern, Sydney.

results.title: Welcome to my home
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the Aboriginal people of Weipa South since the time white men first arrived in 1606. The early influence of church and government is shown using historic footage and interviews with Aboriginal community leaders. Examines Aboriginal life there today and the interaction with the European settlement, which was established at Weipa to mine the bauxite deposit.

results.title: Koalas: Out on a Limb
results.brief_description: A documentary that examines the situation of koalas in the wild. Healthy koalas in the Australian bush are a rare sight these days and there are several different factors that are contributing towards the rapid decline in the population. One of the main factors is venereal disease which causes many females to become infertile.

results.title: Eager to Write (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo, W Buckland F'tion, L Reichstein F'tion and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: For children, the process of learning to write is a gradual and experimental one. This program follows the progress of children of different ages in the classroom. Follows a Myer Foundation program at Moonee Ponds West Primary School with Lorraine Wilson.
